Description of incident: A laptop containing the names, address and Social Security numbers of more than 207,000 Army reservists has been stolen from a government contractor in Georgia. A CD-Rom containing the personal identifiable information was in one of three laptops stolen from the Morrow, Ga., offices of Serco Inc., a government contractor based in Reston, Va. The other laptops did not contain sensitive personal information. Serco had a contract with the U.S. Army's Family and Morale, Welfare and Recreation Division, so some of the pilfered information also could belong to reservists' family members.
